Input button (type="button")

Used when you want to trigger something via javascript

code demo coming soon

Input number (type="number")

This is useful when you need to show an input, but restrict input values to numbers only.

Caveat: Since both e and E stand for "exponent," it is the only alpha character that is allowed within an input with type="number". E.g., 200000 can also be written as 2e5 and still remain valid. To disallow e, you will need to write JavaScript for the consuming application. For a more in-depth discussion, see this thread.

code demo coming soon

Input range (type="range")

TODO: Documentate usage.

code demo coming soon

Input search (type="search")

A search bar is usually coupled with a few items:

  1. A form tag wrapping at least the input and button.
  2. An input element with type="search"
  3. A button to submit the search for accessibility (input type="submit").
